meanings.definition: A punctuation mark (-) used to separate parts of a sentence or to indicate a pause.
meanings.sent1: In the sentence, the author used dashes to separate additional information.
meanings.sent2: She added a dash between the words to show a break in thought.
meanings.sent3: The dashes on the page made the text look like a road with lines.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts ran together like a river until the dashes created boundaries.
meanings.sent5: The dashes stood out like little bridges connecting ideas in the text.

meanings.sent1: He dashes across the finish line, winning the race.
meanings.sent2: The cat dashes out of the room when it hears a loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel dashes up the tree, surprising the birds.
meanings.sent4: Time dashes forward, never looking back.
meanings.sent5: The child dashes through the playground, full of energy and joy.

meanings.definition: A small amount of a liquid ingredient added to a recipe.
meanings.sent1: The recipe calls for a dash of salt to enhance the flavor.
meanings.sent2: She added a dash of vinegar to the salad dressing.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient was a dash of cinnamon in the sauce.
meanings.sent4: A dash of lemon juice brightens up the dish like sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The soup needed just a dash of pepper to bring out the taste.
